patterns.pattern: You utter a low hiss from exertion as you will the power of your blood to repair the wounds your undead body has sustained.
Blood cannot be called upon to repair your walking corpse again so soon.
Flushed with the bounty of purest, unadulterated life, you exert your will to expend your vitality in a surge which knits your flesh in an instant.
You may not invoke the vitality of your lifeforce again quite yet.
You may mend your body once more.
Your body thrums anew, the vitality inherent in your essence ready to once again knit your flesh.
Your blood boils and you let out a mighty roar of defiance.
A soothing glow surrounds you as you draw on spiritual succour, comforting warmth easing your ills.
You cannot purify your blood again so quickly!
The warmth of succour flares for a second time, continuing to soothe what ails you.
You cannot call upon heavenly succour again so soon.
You may purify your blood once more.
You may draw upon spiritual succour once more.
You may defy the clutches of death once more.
Your skin prickles as your blood regains its thickness.
You have not yet recovered from your previous last stand.
You use Discipline Unbroken.
You use Sanguis Deluge.
Your blood reserves has not recovered just yet.
Your deluge defence has been stripped.
You have flooded your undead body with warm, pulsating lifeblood.
